The infection, known as Zika fever or Zika virus disease, shares clinical signs and symptoms with dengue and chikungunya fever, including mild fever, rash, conjunctivitis and joint pain. It has also been linked to severe neurological diseases, such as Guillain–Barré syndrome (a muscle weakness caused by the immune system damaging the peripheral nervous system)
7 and microcephaly, a medical condition in which the brain does not develop properly resulting in a head smaller than its normal size. ZIKV poses a serious threat to public health internationally due to the continuous geographic expansion of both the virus and its mosquito vectors
8 . As for today, there are no known vaccines or specific therapies available for treatment and prevention
